sections.1_story: Imagine looking at a complex picture and trying to find a simple shape hidden within it, like finding a triangle inside a star. In exams, embedded figures questions test your ability to spot a given shape hidden within a larger, more complex figure.
2_definitions: ğŸ’¡ Embedded Figure: A simple shape or pattern hidden within a larger, complex figure.
ğŸ’¡ Complex Figure: A figure made up of multiple lines, shapes, or patterns.
ğŸ’¡ Target Figure: The shape you are asked to find within the complex figure.
ğŸ’¡ Distractor: Extra lines or shapes added to confuse the observer.
ğŸ’¡ Visual Scanning: The process of looking over the entire figure to find the target.
ğŸ’¡ Pattern Recognition: The ability to identify shapes and patterns within a figure.
ğŸ’¡ Rotation: Turning the target figure to match its orientation in the complex figure.
ğŸ’¡ Overlapping: When the target figure shares lines or areas with other shapes.
ğŸ’¡ Partial Match: When only part of the target figure is visible, but not the whole.
ğŸ’¡ Mirror Image: A reversed version of the target figure that may appear in the complex figure.
3_formula_bank: ğŸ§® 1. Scan the entire figure systematically from left to right and top to bottom.
ğŸ§® 2. Compare the target figure with all possible locations in the complex figure.
ğŸ§® 3. Rotate the target figure mentally to match different orientations.
ğŸ§® 4. Ignore distractor lines and focus on the target shape.
ğŸ§® 5. Check for overlapping lines that may hide the target figure.
ğŸ§® 6. Use tracing with a finger or pencil to follow the target shape.
ğŸ§® 7. Break the complex figure into smaller sections for easier scanning.
ğŸ§® 8. Look for unique features of the target figure (e.g., right angles, equal sides).
ğŸ§® 9. Eliminate options where the target figure is incomplete.
ğŸ§® 10. Practice with different types of embedded figures to improve speed.
ğŸ§® 11. Use elimination to rule out figures that do not match.
ğŸ§® 12. Check for mirror images or rotated versions of the target.
ğŸ§® 13. Focus on the starting point of the target figure.
ğŸ§® 14. Use grid lines if available to align the target.
ğŸ§® 15. Visualize the target figure in different positions.
ğŸ§® 16. Mark found figures lightly to avoid double counting.
ğŸ§® 17. Practice with time limits to improve exam speed.
ğŸ§® 18. Check for partial matches but confirm the whole figure is present.
ğŸ§® 19. Use color coding if allowed to highlight the target.
ğŸ§® 20. Review previous year questions for common patterns.
4_micro_examples: Find a triangle hidden inside a star.
Spot a square embedded within a hexagon.
Locate a circle inside a flower pattern.
Identify a rectangle within a grid.
Find a parallelogram inside a complex polygon.
Spot a right angle triangle within a larger triangle.
Locate a pentagon inside a web-like figure.
Find a straight line segment within a spiral.
Identify a T-shape inside a block pattern.
Spot a diamond shape within a cross.

5_exam_examples.problem: Find the triangle embedded in the following star figure.
solution_steps: Scan the star from left to right and top to bottom.
Look for three connected lines forming a triangle.
Ignore extra lines that do not form the triangle.
Confirm all sides of the triangle are present.
5_exam_examples.answer: Triangle found in the lower left section.

5_exam_examples.problem: Spot the square hidden within a hexagon.
solution_steps: Break the hexagon into smaller sections.
Look for four equal sides and right angles.
Ignore lines that extend beyond the square.
Confirm the square is complete.

5_exam_examples.problem: Locate the circle inside a flower pattern.
solution_steps: Scan the flower pattern for round shapes.
Ignore petal lines that do not form a circle.
Check for a closed curve.
Confirm the circle is not broken.

5_exam_examples.problem: Identify the rectangle within a grid.
solution_steps: Look for four sides with opposite sides equal.
Check for right angles at each corner.
Ignore extra grid lines.
Confirm the rectangle is not overlapped.
5_exam_examples.answer: Rectangle found in the top right section.

5_exam_examples.problem: Find the parallelogram inside a complex polygon.
solution_steps: Scan for pairs of parallel lines.
Check for equal opposite sides.
Ignore lines that do not match the parallelogram.
Confirm the shape is closed.
5_exam_examples.answer: Parallelogram found in the lower section.

5_exam_examples.problem: Spot the right angle triangle within a larger triangle.
solution_steps: Look for a triangle with one 90Â° angle.
Check for two sides meeting at a right angle.
Ignore extra lines.
Confirm the triangle is complete.
5_exam_examples.answer: Right angle triangle found at the base.

5_exam_examples.problem: Locate the pentagon inside a web-like figure.
solution_steps: Scan for five connected sides.
Check for equal sides and angles.
Ignore overlapping lines.
Confirm the pentagon is closed.
5_exam_examples.answer: Pentagon found in the upper section.

5_exam_examples.problem: Find the straight line segment within a spiral.
solution_steps: Look for a straight line among curved lines.
Ignore spiral curves.
Confirm the line segment is not broken.
5_exam_examples.answer: Line segment found in the center.

5_exam_examples.problem: Identify the T-shape inside a block pattern.
solution_steps: Look for a vertical and a horizontal line meeting at a right angle.
Ignore extra blocks.
Confirm the T-shape is complete.
5_exam_examples.answer: T-shape found in the left section.

5_exam_examples.problem: Spot the diamond shape within a cross.
solution_steps: Look for four equal sides meeting at sharp angles.
Ignore cross lines that do not form the diamond.
Confirm the diamond is closed.

5_exam_examples.problem: Find the triangle embedded in a complex star pattern.
solution_steps: Scan the star for three connected lines.
Ignore extra lines.
Confirm the triangle is present.
5_exam_examples.answer: Triangle found in the upper right section.

5_exam_examples.problem: Spot the square hidden in a grid of rectangles.
solution_steps: Look for four equal sides and right angles.
Ignore rectangles that are not squares.
Confirm the square is not overlapped.
5_exam_examples.answer: Square found in the lower left section.
